Key Match Events: The Memphis Grizzlies led 61-50 at halftime.
Pre-Game Insights: Many thought Zach Edey would promptly take over the starting center spot in his rookie year.
Coach Taylor Jenkins preferred Santi Aldama over Zach Edey for long stretches.
Post-Match Reflections: It was a forgettable debut for Edey in the Memphis Grizzlies' 126-124 win over the Utah Jazz.
Grizzlies fans will be interested to see if Edey will go to the bench once Jaren Jackson Jr. returns from injury.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Zach Edey played five minutes in the first quarter but returned with 9:44 in the second period for Jay Huff.
Edey finished with five points and five rebounds after fouling out with still 9:15 remaining in the final period.
Aldama's floor-spacing game helps Ja Morant thrive in the paint.
Aldama finished the game with 27 points on 10-for-16 shooting, including 5-for-10 from deep.
Others: Zach Edey debuted on Wednesday for the Memphis Grizzlies against the Utah Jazz.
Edey had an intriguing matchup with Jazz big man Walker Kessler to open the game.
Edey started in the third and fourth quarters but hardly got himself going.
